bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 7 April [1869]

revisionDesc.change: corrected choice encoding of 'eddy'; revised transcripe of 'with' to 'withe' and added choice encoding
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Annotate Mr. Lane, Smith, Mrs. Black

body.p:
i have receeved received the money order to day and i got the letter on saturday Saturday withewith the money in it) it was good in you and good for me it come very acceptable George came home to get his months month's salary as i told you he went away with so little money and went down to the hall to draw it and mrMr. Lane had sent the draft on to him so he thought he was in a fix he had 40 cents and wanted to get boots and things but as it happened Johnny macknemee hadent hadn't drawn his months month's salary so he went and drawd it and let George have what he wanted and George will send it on to him George has gone back to mellvilleMillville for a short time but will come to camdenCamden as soon as he gets the man lane sent out to mellvilleMillville instructed mrMr. Lane said he must stay a week) i suppose you saw the change in the commissioners the new ones has the power to turn out or take in i suppose they are northrop and fowler they are the old board and the two new ones is archibald bliss and the eagle man you know his name Walt quinsella or something like it two democrats and two republicans) mrMr. Lane told George in confidence he was making preparations to settle up affairs he couldent couldn't tell how matters would turn out) but georgeGeorge said he dident didn't think lane expected it but i suppose he wanted to be ready
i am better of my lameness but not entirely over it my knee is so weak but i think it will get better after a while it dont don't pain me as it has done otherways i am about the same cant can't work much have to work a little while and then sit down and rest)

i got worried some about not hearing from han so long so yesterday i sent a few lines to Heyde so i expect to get an account how or what i cant can't tell i hope it will be short but i thought to hear from him would be better than not hearing at all) two or three weeks ago eddEdd was down town and encountered henry rome he talked a great deal about Jess said it was too damed damned bad to keep him there that he henry had broke out and got away he is evedently evidently deranged i dident didn't know but what he would induce Jess to leave and come with him but i dont don't know as they can get away very easy i dont don't know what i should doo do if such should happen they must have much trouble with henry) smith told George he came running up the street the other day without hat or coat or shoes i thought walterWalter dear maybee maybe it would be better for you to write to the Doctor and see if he is as usual i dont don't put any faith in what he said but at first it made me feel bad i beleive believe he told eddyEddy Jess wouldent come) i got a letter from mattyMatty she has not been so well but is gaining again she and the children talks some of going to minesota Minnesota to stay the summer) well waltWalt its most moving time we shant shan't go georgeGeorge says till nearly mayMay on account of the house getting dry George succeded succeeded when he was here to get a loan on smiths Smith's hous for 32 hundred doll dollars he asked lotts if he could depend on it lott told him yes he would get it for him if he lott went to the poorhouse i suppose you know Emily price is going to get married i thought not in some time but mrsMrs. black says quite soon his name is law an artist in the cheap picture line quit quit poor but very free from bad habits quit pleasing i beleive believe
